questions.question: Which of the following is the goal of the A* algorithm?

answers.a: To find the shortest path between two points in a graph
answers.b: To find the longest path between two points in a graph
answers.c: To find all possible paths between two points in a graph
answers.d: To find the minimum spanning tree of a graph

questions.question: What is the heuristic function used in the A* algorithm?
What is the significance of the A* algorithm's f-score?

answers.a: It is the total cost of the path from the start node to the goal node.
answers.b: It is the heuristic estimate of the remaining cost from the current node to the goal node.
answers.c: It is the sum of the g-score and h-score of a node.
answers.d: It is the depth of a node in the search tree.

questions.question: Which data structure is used to store the open set in the A* algorithm?
Which of the following is a drawback of the A* algorithm?

answers.a: It always finds the shortest path between two points.
answers.b: It can get stuck in local optima.
answers.c: It is not suitable for large graphs
answers.d: It does not use a heuristic function.
